title: Correlation: Coffee and the Weather
question_text:
A small neighborhood coffee shop sells both hot coffee drinks and iced coffee drinks. The owners of the coffee shop decided to investigate the relationship between the outside high temperature on a given day and the number of hot coffee drinks that they are able to sell that day. The computer output is shown below.

Determine the correlation coefficient for this relationship.

The explanatory variable

Since the slope of the LSRL is negative, the relationship between the number of orders for hot coffee and the outside high temperature is negative. As the temperature increases, we would expect fewer orders for hot coffee. Also, if we know that the relationship is negative, then the correlation value

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect. This value represents the slope for the LSRL. While the slope and the correlation values will both have the same sign (positive or negative), the value of the slope is unlikely to also be the value for the correlation. Also, correlation is always a value between
−
